        tileWidth - The width of each tile.

      • loadMap

        public static void loadMap(java.awt.Image img)
                    throws RenderingError
        This loads a bitmap for the level. The system regarding which tile to choose is as follows: X coordinate (according to tile registry) = Amount of red in pixel / 10 Y coordinate (" ") = Amount of blue in pixel / 10 Collidable = Amount of green in pixel (0-127 = collide; 128-255 = No collide.) When both red and blue in a pixel are at a value of 255, the program assumes that nothing should be there.
        Parameters:
        img - The bitmap
        Throws:
        RenderingError - Occurs when the engine is in the wrong mode.

      • getCollisionAny

        public static boolean getCollisionAny(double posx,
                      double posy,
                      int w,
                      int h)
        This method detects if an object is colliding with a tile.
        Parameters:
        posx - Object's X coordinate (top-right)
        posy - Object's Y coordinate.
        w - Object's width
        h - Object's height
        Returns:
        If it is colliding with something.

      • getCollisionByType

        public static boolean getCollisionByType(int tileX,
                         int tileY,
                         int ox,
                         int oy,
                         int w,
                         int h)
        This method will detect if the object is colliding with a specific type of square.
        Parameters:
        tileX - The tile's X value in tilesheet
        tileY - The tile's Y value in tilehsheet.
        ox - The object's Position x.
        oy - The object's Position y.
        w - The object's width
        h - The object's height
        Returns:
        Whether it does collide or not.
